chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Spencer Christian Braier-Pritula was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: concurrent to count 2 and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 34 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.

miscConds.notes:
AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Restitution is set at $0 (zero).
Court orders defendant not provide DNA sample or pay the DNA surcharge due to the date of the offense.
Pay all costs and surcharges, out of up to 25% prison funds, as a condition of probation, any balance due by the end probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Seek and maintain full time employment.
Obtain high school diploma or GED.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H/I felony or misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement on count 1.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.

Court orders a referral to the Mental health unit of the Probation department.
Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: concurrent to count 1 and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 34 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Spencer Christian Braier-Pritula

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Spencer Christian Braier-Pritula in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

AS TO AMENDED COUNTS 1 & 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, concurrent to count 2 and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 34 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 18 MONTHS with the following conditions:

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  90 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to count 1 and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 34 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 18 MONTHS with the following conditions:
*
AS TO BOTH COUNTS
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Court orders a referral to the Mental health unit of the Probation department.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*Restitution is set at $0 (zero).

Court orders defendant not provide DNA sample or pay the DNA surcharge due to the date of the offense.

- Pay all costs and surcharges, out of up to 25% prison funds, as a condition of probation, any balance due by the end probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.  Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H/I felony or misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement on count 1.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement. 

- Received and filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Spencer Christian Braier-Pritula in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended information filed.
  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to COUNT 1:  Obstructing/Resisting an Officer, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 946.41(1), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A misdemeanor and COUNT 2:  Disorderly Conduct, 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b), a Class B misdemeanor.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-03-2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM016809  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03-31-15

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 03/10/2015 received and filed. (16 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Guerin Law Office, Attorney Eamon C. Guerin, 2240 South Aldrich Street, Milwaukee, WI 53207.
Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order received, signed, and filed with court.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion To Dismiss Information Not Supported by Evidence received and filed with court.

Attorney Eamon Collins Guerin in court, defendant Spencer Christian Braier-Pritula not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed by the Defense:  Notice of Motion and Motion to Dismiss Information Not Supported by Evidence.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Spencer Christian Braier-Pritula in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Defendant Spencer Christian Braier-Pritula in custody.  James Griffen for Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: South Milwaukee Police Officer Christopher Rohde.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Spencer Christian Braier-Pritula in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Spencer Christian Braier-Pritula in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
